title: OLD Definition & Meaning - Merriam-Webster
text: older; oldest 1 a : dating from the remote past : ancient old traditions b : persisting from an earlier time an old ailment they brought up the same old argument c : of long standing an old friend This recipe is an old favorite. 2 a : distinguished from an object of the same kind by being of an earlier date many still used the old name b Old : belonging to an early period in the development of a language or literature Old Persian 3 : having existed for a specified period of time a child three years old 4 : of, relating to, or originating in a past era old chronicles record the event 5 a : advanced in years or age an old person = (more politely) an older person b : showing the characteristics of age looked old at 20 6 : experienced an old trooper speaking of the last war 7 : former his old students 8 9 a : long familiar the old routine told the same old story b —used as an intensive a high old time Good old Joe. He always chips in. c —used to express an attitude of affection or amusement a big old dog flex the old biceps any old time see also any old 1 : one of a specified age —usually used in combination a 3-year-old 2 : old or earlier time —used in the phrase of old the cavalry of old Love words? Need even more definitions? Merriam-Webster unabridged
